For it's price I'll recommend it and it's probably something my kids would love but..... I have to admit I wasn't blow away, I don't know if it's becuase I've been spoiled with other snow based games like 'Edge of Nowhere', 'The Climb' or 'Steep' but I didn't get that VR buzz.The sense of speed was OK, but the graphics were very minimal and bland. I really wanted to like this game more as it's the first time I've tried skiing in VR, and it's a shame it's not in early access so they can add more content and improvements. A bar has been set for VR and sadly I feel this is slightly below it.If this was your very first 'Ever' VR experience then it would be great! However if your a VR vet you'll probably feel a bit let down.

			Another attempt to clear my backlog. Sprint Vector at PAX had me interested in 'runner' type games so I figured I'd give Alpine Ski VR a try. Boy was that a mistake. Where do I start? ....		

Sprint Vector at PAX had me interested in 'runner' type games so I figured I'd give Alpine Ski VR a try.Boy was that a mistake. Where do I start? ....The poles stick directly perpendicular to how they would naturally be held. This is incredibly awkward.Menu selection is all look based. Including the option to reset your camera angle... The reset your camera angle option is pointless if you have to look at the option to select it...The on screen prompts for controls all reference either keyboard or controller buttons. None of them reference Vive buttons.The poles frequently did not make contact with the ground. Especially at the start of a race.I could go on but I'll just say that the game was thoroughly unimpressive on all counts.

												While I'm giving this a recommended review I have to say it's still rather early and light on content.  What's there is pretty good but none of the runs (that I've seen anyway) are very long at all.  Since it's a virtual world it would be far better if the runs were super long or even near endless.  Doing the heli-skiing due to the way the mountains are laid out you only get a minute or two of downhill before you hit the bottom of a bowl and have to go back up.I am refunding it but definitely plan to buy it again down the line when it's either finished or closer.  I have a ton of respect for small indie/single developers like this and with what's here now I assume there is a lot more good to come.  While I felt the head tilt works well for carving downhill for me it was far less good for trying jumps and tricks.Looking forward to seeing where this goes.
